result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew T McGraw in court.  Attorney Erika L Bierma in court for Andrew T McGraw.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 1. FOP referral. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to ct 1. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication. Court requests pre-screening for FOP.  Bail continued.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew T McGraw in court.  Attorney Erika L Bierma in court for Andrew T McGraw.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties request plea hearing.

and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CAM, MDD, JO, or JO. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

08:32 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Erika L Bierma.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
